links.quantification: 80% reuse → 15 BCM/year wastewater recycled → freshwater demand -30% in cities → ₹20K Cr new supply infrastructure avoided
Mandatory reuse → industries source 60% water from STPs → ₹8K Cr treatment plant upgrades → circular water economy
Power plant cooling via treated water → 5 BCM freshwater freed → reservoir levels stabilize → hydropower generation +8%
Peri-urban irrigation with treated water → 2M ha vegetable farming sustained → ₹15K Cr agricultural output → food-water circularity
Treatment capacity gap: Need 25 BCM/year capacity; have 10 BCM → ₹50K Cr STP investment → 7-year infrastructure buildout
Stigma barrier: Public resistance to treated water in parks → perceived contamination risk → education campaigns needed → cultural acceptance lag
Reduced freshwater extraction → river flows sustained → fish populations recover → wetland ecosystems expand (reinforcing)
Requires dual piping infrastructure: Reuse mandates only work with separate distribution → ₹15K Cr pipeline network prerequisite
Via treatment: STP energy use 0.5 kWh/m³ → 7.5 TWh/year demand → but avoids 15 TWh pumping from distant sources → net savings
Via peri-urban farming: Treated water irrigation → local vegetable supply → food security improves → ₹5K Cr consumer savings
Via ecosystem services: River flow restoration → urban cooling +2°C → heat stress reduction → ₹500 Cr health savings
